review: You can run every single game in 1080p with ultra settings at 60+ fps. The only game i've had some issues with is warzone but it's very likely to be a processor problem because it hits 100% processor usage. If you are thinking on this graphics card to play warzone check some processor configuration on youtube to be sure it's gonna work just fine because with my i7 7700 it runs +60 fps but has a lot of stuttering issues.

I honestly think its a lil more powerful than i need! But i was shopping for a new graphics card bc i thought mine was wearing down(it turned out to be an hdmi issue instead. Embarrassing.) Figured if i was gonna need a new one i mind as well upgrade it.

Resulta que el precio es uno de los mÃ¡s accesibles en cuanto a rendimiento en juegos se refiere. El chip grÃ¡fico es excelente para 1080 e incluso para 1440. La presentaciÃ³n que hace MSI en cambio deja una impresiÃ³n algo ambigua. Si bien la grÃ¡fica luce muy bien cuando estÃ¡ montada en el gabinete la sensaciÃ³n de los materiales hace entender el por quÃ© del precio. I use this for my gaming pc. As a college student money is a bit tight but I spent a bit of my college relief fund on one of these. Overall I definitely don't regret it. My only issue is during install windows did not detect it so we had to go into the bios of the computer inform it was there and that allowed us to upload the drivers necessary.

I have had it for a month and it has handled everything I have thrown at it. No problems running Saints Row. Drivers were a little troublesome when I was first setting up but now it is stable and running well.

This card will run 1080p Maxed settings well over 100 fps in most games and keep power consumption below 100w. 1440p is somewhat do-able in lower demanding titles but I wouldn't expect more than 100fps in most cases unless you turn down a bunch of settings. The card is somewhat noisy in general once the fans go around 50 percent so adjust the fan curve to your liking in the radeon software. I use the RSR/FSR 2.0 to really get the most out of this card and personally it's working out pretty well.However the Rx 6600 line of cards should have only been $250 MSRP at most; with the 6600XT being $280-300 like the previous 5600XT was. The performance improvements are not worth another $50 from what the 5600XT was offering and that card was already a disaster at launch from how AMD scrambled to get that one released. No such case here luckily for someone like me who is not the most proficient pc enthusiast.
Bought it a month ago and works perfectly. Very happy with the purchase :)
Great Card for the money.  Yes it's not an XT but for the price I have no complaints. Do yourself a favor and look at this you won't be disappointed.

Pros: It was readily available when I wanted to upgrade my 1050ti. It doubles performance on every game I have (except GTA IV it does worse for some reason). Fans are off most of the time unless Iâ€™m playing a newer game maxed out.Cons: Itâ€™s kind of loud when under heavy load and the fans kick into high gear.I paired this with a Ryzen 5 5600g and 32gb 3200mhz ram. Overall I just decided to build my first pc at a time when the graphics card market is in shambles so I canâ€™t complain too much about price because idk how prices used to be. But for the $60 above msrp I paid itâ€™s an amazing 1080p60 max settings card. I came from only having consoles for almost 20 years and I play mostly rpgs or racing games so a locked 60fps isnâ€™t a deal breaker. DOOM BL3 Sekiro Far Cry 4 MGSV Forza Horizon 4 and 5 all run max graphics with no stutters or lag.

It's a damn good card for the price when you think about the times we are coming out of.I was tired of gaming on an iGPU and for 320 bucks I just bit the bullet. It serves the 1080p purpose real well and even 1440p 60fps is achievable if you pull those ultra settings down a notch.IMPORTANT: If you're an overclocker don't get this MSI model. It's wattage is limited to the stock 100 watts unlike most other 6600s in the market. I don't mind and if you aren't an overclocking kinda guy you really shouldn't care too much either. It will still let you undervolt and overclock it you just won't be able to make it pull more power which will limit how much you can push it.
I was actually really happy with the spike buy caught it on sale make sure you buy a mounting bracket or a stand for it itâ€™s very heavy.

One of my all time favorite games Doom has run on every Nvidia graphics Bd for years. I had just bought the latest version on Steam and has worked great. Since I installed the AMD 6600 Bd every time I launch the game it's starts loading and stops. My computer is locked up and must do a cold reset.  This problem has happened three times. I plugged my HDMI cable into the built in graphics port on my motherboard and it played just fine.

The RX 6600 provides great value for gaming but this MSI Mech is locked at only 100W whereas most others allow +20% for a total PPT of 120W. I was very disappointed when I discovered this. Thankfully there is More Power Tool which allowed me to raise the power level. I was able to go from ~8300 in Timespy to ~9200 GPU score. Overall I'm very satisfied with this GPU and deducted a star for the low power level.

It does an ok job.  The GPU crisis meant that i had to buy this at 1100 dollars as my old GPU died.  The graphics are marginally better than a 2060ti.  But in all honesty wait until prices come down as this GPU really should only cost 500 dollars.

I purchased this to replace a five-year-old GTX 1060 and honestly AMD wasn't my first choice but with current pricing the RX6600 seemed like the best available value for something that offered a significant performance uplift from my prior card.It handily outperforms a RTX3050 and for less money.This MSI card has been very good so far gives 60+ fps at 1080p in most of the titles I've tried at max settings (barring MS Flight Simulator). A bit less plastic (i.e: in the backplate) might be nice but overall the build quality seems good.With utilization at 100% the fans kick up to about 2000 RPM and become audible but I haven't found it to be intrusive (and it's not noticeable when I have AC on). I think this is probably something that could be addressed by tweaking the fan curves a little something I haven't done. But the hottest I've seen the card get is 61C and GPU hotspot temps tend to run about 10-12 degrees higher so there's some headroom to let it run warmer probably.
